newsitem.title: JAPAN: Key 10-yr JGB yield falls to record low 2.120 pct.
newsitem.headline: Key 10-yr JGB yield falls to record low 2.120 pct.

text.p: The yield of the benchmark three percent 182nd 10-year Japanese government bond (JGB) fell to a record low of 2.120 percent in late Tokyo trade on Friday, traders said.

The JGB's bull run was helped along by continued buying interest in JGBs and non-JGB issues from institutional investors as well as flight-to-quality purchases of JGBs by holders of bank debentures, traders said.
The benchmark 182nd JGB yield had closed at 2.175 percent on Thursday.
